title: SS.PT.008
prompt: The right to bear arms, stated in the second amendment, was included in the Bill of Rights primarily in order to
feedback: There have been many modern arguments for maintaining the second amendment right to bear arms, but the text of the amendment begins, “A well regulated Militia, being necessary to the security of a free State…” A militia is an armed civilian force. Early revolutionaries began as a militia of armed civilians rebelling against their government. Many citizens during the formation of the nation were concerned about maintaining their ability to rebel against unfair government policies, and this was at the root of the second amendment.
